intro: Aulacospermum cuneatum, commonly known as the narrow-leaved sandmat, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of southern Africa. It is a low-growing shrub characterized by its narrow, linear leaves and small, clustered yellow flowers. The plant thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Its botanical features include a woody stem and small, fleshy fruits that contain seeds. Aulacospermum cuneatum is often found in sandy or rocky habitats, contributing to the ecological diversity of its native environment.
